results.3-3: [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.8MD1vRBTcgSXXk3u]{Magmin} can be spotted burning foliage through the trees. They haven’t started a fire yet, but they will if left unchecked.
results.4-4: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.hQt3qIahnB1Odb40]{giant elk} appears in a peaceful glade, drinking from a mysterious pond with an abundance of plant life. There is a sense of calm and serenity here. Each character that stops to drink from the pond heals [[/r 1d4 + 2]] hit points.
results.5-5: [[/r 1d4 + 1]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.h3bgFDVaSI9OrtKX]{mapach bandits} and a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.dqaiPZmEvif1q7FU]{jerbeen thief} spring from the forest, offering safe passage for a road toll of 3 gp per party member. They will attack if the toll is not paid immediately.
results.6-6: A traveling @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.r9NadEFx3JU8Rg9b]{gallus druid} is met on the road. She has a calm demeanour and will inform the party of The Tenders (see Appendix B, pg. 206), an organization to which she belongs. She has two bags of poultice that she will sell for 15 gp apiece. Each can be applied to a wound to heal [[/r 1d4 + 2]] hit points.
results.7-7: A small pool of water giving off mist can be seen in a clearing. Disturbing the pool reveals that the mist is actually steam and the water is scalding. [[/r 1d4 + 1]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.UthHOT7QfZfEIUue]{Steam Mephits} appear and attack immediately.
results.8-8: A bandit’s net trap has been laid across the trail and covered with leaves. It can be spotted with a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check. If characters walk into it, the trap springs, and characters must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw to avoid getting caught. On a failure, you can roll on this table again to complicate the encounter.

results.1-1: A carefully cleaned and varnished mouse skull.
results.2-2: A ruby statue worth 50 gp, but birdfolk and humblefolk alike believe it to be cursed.
results.3-3: A golden coin dating back to the very founding of Alderheart.
results.4-4: A small switch-knife hidden inside of a wooden spoon.
results.5-5: A holy symbol of an Amaranthine not worshiped in Humblewood.
results.6-6: A feather with brilliant tropical colors, not seen on any Humblewood birdfolk.
results.7-7: A ring with a strange seed where a gemstone would normally be.
results.8-8: A mechanical cricket, but its winding key is missing.
results.9-9: A thin length of chain, that when examined is actually made of seamless loops of wood.
results.10-10: A small bag containing hand polished marbles, each one with a different small insect in it.
results.11-11: A necklace made from the shells of small iridescent beetles.
results.12-12: A wooden frog that is perpetually slick with  some kind of viscous moisture.
results.13-13: A short, thin twig that is unbendable and indestructible. A locket made from a polished periwinkle shell.
results.14-14: A strange sigil has been carved on the inside.
results.15-15: A glass jar filled with eight fireflies, each giving off light. One glows white, and the others glow a different color of the rainbow.
results.16-16: A bandit mask from a time before the Coalition.
results.17-17: A detailed onyx carving of a birdfolk skull. It is cold to the touch.
results.18-18: A silver pinecone that is completely immune to fire damage.
results.19-19: A locked music box. Mechanical chirping can  occasionally be heard from inside.
results.20-20: A weathered parchment scroll, which unfurls to reveal music inscribed in long-faded ink.

results.1-1: Two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.h052EIIUmRwJum65]{Griffon} can be seen in the distance. They give a warning shriek. The party can find another route, losing ground and rolling again on this table, or fight them.
results.6-6: The weather suddenly shifts to a bitter storm. If the party chooses not to take shelter, they must make a [[/save constitution 13 format=long]] while traveling, suffering a level of &Reference[Exhaustion] from the cold on a failure.
results.7-7: The party finds a weathered shrine to Altus. The first character that stops to pray here gains the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.9eOZDBImVKxbeOyZ]{enhance ability} once, without using material components. The player may only select either the Bear’s Endurance or Bull’s Strength options when the spell is cast.
results.8-8: The party finds a roost of [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.9bHoR8k5D2DKHaF3]{Giant Eagles} with [[/r 1d4]] young (Medium sized beasts that cannot attack) with them. They will attack unless the party can convince them they are not a threat.

results.1-1: A sudden rock slide! Make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or suffer one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.apBZudO4UA1wj7aC]{exhaustion}. Roll again on this table.
results.2-2: Bandit patrol of four @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.h3bgFDVaSI9OrtKX]{mapach bandits} led by a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.PSJMjoZ9u5fJymKA]{vulpin captain}.
results.4-4: Find an old birdfolk hermit’s campsite containing [[/r 1d4]] random common objects.
results.5-5: Find an old but serviceable explorer’s pack, missing the rations.
results.6-6: Bandit patrol of three @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.h3bgFDVaSI9OrtKX]{mapach bandits} and two @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.dqaiPZmEvif1q7FU]{jerbeen thieves}.

results.1-1: A thicket containing a hidden @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.gGeLeV411iQ5Yijs]{shambling mound}, which attacks as soon as a character enters its reach. It can be seen with a passive perception of 14 or higher.
results.2-2: A group of [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.hQt3qIahnB1Odb40]{giant elk} can be seen grazing peacefully by a grove with a clear pond.
results.3-3: The bones of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.hQt3qIahnB1Odb40]{giant elk}, picked clean and growing moss. A successful DC 17 Intelligence (Nature) check is enough to tell this was done by a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.tBaMDYmEK7XYjakj]{forest prowler}.
results.4-4: A 60-foot-wide clearing contains [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.SsuCaF2fIEoDdFA3]{giant boars} rooting around the soil for food. They have [[/r 1d4]] young (Medium sized beasts that cannot attack) with them and will attack if provoked.
results.5-5: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.zY3W5MG7FjssENf6]{owlbear} can be seen in a clearing nearby. It is young (only has half its normal hit points) and hasn’t yet spotted the party. There is another owlbear, its mother, also nearby. The mother will arrive after a round of combat has passed to defend her child.
results.6-6: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.G9PENY6nw0xRxCJW]{unicorn} appears in a small grove. It is wary, but can be approached if the party is careful. If befriended, it will heal the party’s wounds. If threatened, it will flee.

results.1-1: Deed to a house in Brackenmill
results.4-4: A small clockwork squirrel made of bronze. It will hop for 1 minute after it has been properly wound.
results.5-5: Token with a ram’s head on it
results.6-6: An old spellbook with [[/r 1d6]] random 1st level spells, [[/r 1d4]] random 2nd level spells, and 1 random 3rd level spell  (choose from the Wizard’s spell list).

results.1-1: [[/r 1d2]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.fqbFYtbtkrL53FOC]{Gray Oozes} conceal themselves as stagnent pools.
results.3-3: [[/r 1d2]] roosting @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.Actor.J0AoMMjswKQu0eMH]{Swarm of Emberbats} drop from the ceiling.
results.5-5: The party finds a 6-foot-tall bioluminescent mushroom.
results.7-7: Two @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.dhOYowRoDrwjeFxU]{Sticky Slimes} and a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.ZpNHEuM9NMTE8G8h]{Caustic Slime} attack.

results.1-1: A @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.dTI5IrvmeAdjLJSs]{Mapach Tinkerer} with a hand cart of goods distracts the party with his marvelous wares while his @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.uBYdlxHr1iB9lesm]{Hedge Bard} partner attempts to pickpocket them.
results.2-2: An innocent @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.gPQ4zrfbASrQ2oVo]{Cervan Priest} is accosted by [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.2EDk0AShOqTwZfqC]{Birdfolk Guards}. These birdfolk are criminals who’ve stolen Perch Guard uniforms, and the party will be rewarded for their capture.
results.3-3: A visiting @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.wKelq8u337t3AhG9]{Vulpin Noble} is interested in seeing the sights. Show them around town by rolling again on this table. They will accompany the party for this encounter, and should they survive, will reward the party [[/award 20gp]]   for the invigorating time.
results.4-4: A gathering of acrobatic street performers. If high enough level, a party member with the Sharp Mind trait, or who makes a [[/check intelligence 14 format=long]], will recognize a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.grUwcvMkHImEfVZl]{Gallus Monk} among them from a wanted poster.
results.5-5: A citywide parade to honor Gaspard, the Champion. There are jousts, fencing matches, and other contests in which the party can participate. Defeat a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.XESMIRVOWJq9P9ep]{Jerbeen Swashbuckler} in a duel to win a magic item.
results.6-6: A mysterious death. If players are high enough level, this could lead to a fight with the @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.lHSQUFCLeL4THZwP]{Corvum Assassin} who was paid to perform the murder.
results.7-7: A bar fight breaks out between [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.h3bgFDVaSI9OrtKX]{Mapach Bandit} patrons and [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.gvTAebrTCmd9AE9C]{Birdfolk Militia}.
results.8-8: A pair of @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.dqaiPZmEvif1q7FU]{Jerbeen Thieves} steal from the party. This leads back to their @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.PSJMjoZ9u5fJymKA]{Vulpin Captain} leader, who runs a pickpocketing ring in town.

results.1-1: The party finds a small shrine to Gesme within a hidden grotto. The first player to pray here gains the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} once, without material components.
results.2-2: Two @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.l7EoOb2MPgXbYgPb]{Raptor Explorers} are leading a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.T9YStLiWtUch1T9D]{Strig Tracker} bounty hunter to the party.
results.3-3: [[/r 1d4]] giant petrels circle overhead (use the stat block for a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.9bHoR8k5D2DKHaF3]{Giant Eagle}, but with a 30 ft. swim speed).
results.4-4: A violent storm rolls in. If the party chooses not to take shelter, they must make a [[/save constitution 14 format=long]] while traveling, suffering a level of exhaustion on a failure.
results.5-5: A mass of seaweed turns out to be a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.gGeLeV411iQ5Yijs]{Shambling Mound}.
results.6-6: A ship is stolen from the docks by [[/r 1d4 + 1]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.BFmKFzntuF8gsEFV]{Birdfolk Sailor} pirates, led by a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.XESMIRVOWJq9P9ep]{Jerbeen Swashbuckler}.
results.7-7: A sinking ship is spotted with its crew aboard. There are [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.siBUEAj4UVdaiH6p]{Hunter Sharks} circling in the water.
results.8-8: A crashing wave sweeps in, and the party must make a [[/save strength 14 format=long]] or be swept 80 feet into the sea, where a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.namJz755U1EhvEJa]{Water Elemental} lies in wait.

results.1-1: [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.ufgB8yIxGJv7oCuv]{Birdfolk Skeletons}, covered in moss rise from the murky water and attack.
results.2-2: Two @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.dhOYowRoDrwjeFxU]{Sticky Slimes} and a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.ZpNHEuM9NMTE8G8h]{Caustic Slime} attack.
results.3-3: The party stumbles upon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.KXG5XLIwKhn1V0Y5]{Swarm of Quippers} in the water. Players with a passive Perception of 15 or higher notice the swarm and avoid it.
results.4-4: The party finds a fungus covered shrine to Henwin within a tangle of plant life. The first character to pray here gains the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-spells.yF6iHyIDz5fNOGD2]{Spiny Shield} once, without using material components.
results.6-6: [[/r 1d2]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.S0zDrv6lbnwWaz9E]{Swarms of Insects} envelop the party. They have a walking speed of 5 ft., a 30 ft. flying speed, and no climbing speed.
results.8-8: A birdfolk researcher caught in quicksand. Requires a [[/check athletics 12 format=long]] to free. Roll again on this table to complicate the encounter.

results.3-3: [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.8MD1vRBTcgSXXk3u]{Magmin} can be spotted burning foliage through the trees. They haven’t started a fire yet, but they will if left unchecked.
results.4-4: The party finds a moss covered shrine to Reya. The first character that stops to pray here gains the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-spells.zUVjuFmFZ0uuqGjh]{Elevated Sight} once.
results.5-5: [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.h3bgFDVaSI9OrtKX]{Mapach Bandits} and a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.dqaiPZmEvif1q7FU]{Jerbeen Thief} spring from the forest, offering safe passage for a road toll of 3 gp per party member. They will attack if the toll is not paid immediately.
results.6-6: [[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.yawTeS8u2FCfzzZH]{Wolves} led by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.EYiQZ3rFL25fEJY5]{Dire Wolf} attack the party.
results.7-7: A @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-npcs.Actor.PpwJObHEYQ8O5LzT]{Birdfolk Skirmisher} on patrol is struggling in a large spider web and calling for help. He has been bound in silk, requiring a [[/check strength 15 format=long]] or one round using a cutting tool to free him. There are [[/r 1d2 + 1]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.v99wOosUJjUgcUNF]{Giant Spider} hidden in the trees.
results.8-8: A bandit’s net trap has been laid across the trail and covered with leaves. It can be spotted with a [[/check 15 perception format=long]]. If players walk into it, the trap springs, and players must make a [[/save dexterity 14 format=long]] to avoid getting caught. On a failure, you can roll on this table again to complicate the encounter.

results.2-2: An @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.p3POV3A1C2gc2Y57]{Ashsnake} attacks. If the party is hunting for the ashsnake in @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-campaign-setting.ytg7RBRcHdPD3HIq]{Part 3}, it is waiting to ambush them.
results.3-3: The party finds a small stand of scorched trees, two of which tower above the others. When approached these two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.UR2gWLFHmFwG7ReH]{Awakened Trees} attack with branches that glow with embers. Their attacks deal fire damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and can set flammable objects carried by characters on fire.
results.4-4: One @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.8SMQl75HLjhuSeau]{Fire Elemental} can be seen off in the distance. Players must make a [[/check stealth 10 format=long]] to avoid its notice, otherwise it will see them and attack.
results.7-7: A Tender is being attacked by a @UUID[Compendium.hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.J0AoMMjswKQu0eMH]{Swarm of Emberbats}.
results.8-8: A field of geysers lays ahead, each intermittently spraying scalding gases into the air. The party can attempt to cross cautiously with a [[/check intelligence 16 format=long]] to notice a pattern, or by making three [[/save dexterity 14  format=long]], taking [[/damage 1d8 fire average]] damage on each failure. Pass or fail, after 3 saving throws they’ve made it across. Alternatively, party members can choose to go around. If so, roll again on this table.
